metadata.title: CVE-2019-11599 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The coredump implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.0.10 does not uselocking or other mechanisms to prevent vma layout or vma flags changeswhile it runs, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information,cause a denial of service, or possibly have unspecified other impact bytriggering a race condition with mmget_not_zero or get_task_mm calls. Thisis related to fs/userfaultfd.c, mm/mmap.c, fs/proc/task_mmu.c, anddrivers/infiniband/core/uverbs_main.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11599` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
